Then why don't you guys change it so you blink forward instead of backwards?.... Or have the option TO blink kinda like HOW TALON SHOULD HAVE!!!!!! GIVE HIM BACK HIS BLINK DAMNIT!!!!!!!!! STICK IT ON HIS ULT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
YEAH! AND DOUBLE HIS DAMAGE ON EVERY ABILITY!
No. Give him %hp true dmg. That's the real deal-maker.
no give him triple crit passive
No he needs 100% base crit
Why not just straight up give 100%?
RIP sword of the divine

It's about when you ult because you think it finishes them but they survive with 1 HP, like Graves ult. Just feelsbadman.
I r8 7/8, didn't even know it was fish.
Might be a dumb question, but ult into the enemy team by accident or on purpose?  Is there any strategic value to using the new Evelynn's ult as a gapcloser that way?

If it's a skirmish, it might be useful. In a teamfight, blowing your only escape as a gapcloser is gonna be dangerous most of the times.
If you look at the champion spotlight, Evelynn ults towards an enemy tower to secure a kill once.

Sounds like the right answer.

This isn't a dumb question - a lot of things in LoL that sound like dumb questions have surprisingly deeper answers than expected.
Like, how to utilize Soraka's E, the silence, and if it hurts only champions. Or, is building Thornmail on Ashe a good idea lol

Might be working just because I'm low ELO, but I actually play Soraka aggro.
Her E is a strong tool for trades, because it's instant silence. Walk up, E auto Q auto, then run away. Any damage they do you heal up, and they don't do too much damage anyway because of the silence..
And I must rate your demonstration video 1/10, for not showing said "lots of damage".
That is phreaks job Tons of damage https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iexPTpv_4_c

That's only if they are low health and her reworked kit lacks the damage to get them that low regardless of build paths.

It does a lot of damage unless the enemy player walks away before the damage hits like a second and a half after the animation goes out. It's basically a fully charged Nunu ult but about 1/10th the area with no slow or ability to detonate it early. But ya, if you are executing low health AFKs, Eve ult is amazing!

Well uuuuummmm... it does show {{champion:21}}'s life bar  getting more than halved, the joke was about players who are going to miss last hitting and warps too far to fnish the champ, it's not about its damage...

I rate your rating ok/10 {{champion:33}}

My favorite part of this is how bad the photoshopping is.

This is a top tier meme. Well crafted my good sir-or-ma'am.
http://www.reactiongifs.com/r/cwkss.gif
Lol nice, i'm also pretty sure theres like a marker that indicates that they'll die to it (like zed's ult).{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
the marker is not a death indicator its simply shows if the target is below 30% max hp for the bonus damage to trigger.
since people will associate it with Chogath's Utl Marker that guarrantees kill this will be a hard time for people who don't know.
To be fair, the ult does 300/550/800 (+1.5 AP) to targets below 30% so most of the time it's a guaranteed kill on indicated target.
but not all the time, specially if the enemy has a ton of hp (a tank usually), or has damage reduction from some source.
or a shield {{item:3190}} {{champion:40}} {{summoner:21}}
Though most people at 30% HP will die to Eve ult.

It does a buttload of damage. 800 base damage with i believe a 75% ish ap scaling when people are under 30% health and half of that when they are above 30%? So basically everyone who is under 30% will mostly die.
150% ap ratio below 30% actually, it's overkill tbh.
Now I'm waiting for a new NB3 clickbait about 1000 AP Evelynn ulting someone for 2500 damage

150 % under 30?!?!

That just insane.
Plus said 800 base.

>
> 150% ap ratio below 30% actually, it's overkill tbh.

Ekko ult as 150% AP ratio always.

Its so Evelynn has kill potential on even tanks.

TBH it IS overkill and you should just be ulting once they hit about half HP. thing has incredible base damage and scaling.
Well to be fair her Q has a total of 330 (+195% AP) damage at max rank
